title: Kyoto Weekend Escape
description: A quick 2-day escape to Kyoto — bamboo groves, golden temples, matcha everything, and the most beautiful gardens in the world.

activities.title: Shinkansen Tokyo → Kyoto
activities.description: Nozomi bullet train from Tokyo Station. About 2h15m. Book reserved seats in advance.

activities.title: Arashiyama Bamboo Grove
activities.description: Walk through the iconic bamboo forest. Go early to avoid crowds — the light filtering through the bamboo is magical.
activities.tips: Best visited before 10am for photos without crowds.

activities.title: Tenryu-ji Temple
activities.description: UNESCO World Heritage site with one of the finest landscape gardens in Kyoto.

activities.title: Lunch at Shoraian
activities.description: Tofu restaurant on the river with mountain views. Traditional Kyoto cuisine in a serene setting.

activities.title: Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion)
activities.description: The iconic gold-leaf covered temple reflected in a mirror pond. One of Japan's most photographed spots.

activities.title: Check in at Hoshinoya Kyoto
activities.description: A riverside ryokan accessible only by boat. Pure luxury and tranquility.

activities.title: Kaiseki Dinner
activities.description: Multi-course traditional Japanese dinner at the ryokan. Seasonal ingredients, artistic presentation.
activities.tips: This is included with the stay — some of the best food you'll ever have.

activities.title: Fushimi Inari Taisha (Sunrise)
activities.description: 10,000 vermillion torii gates winding up the mountain. Going at sunrise means you'll have the trails almost to yourself.
activities.tips: The full hike to the summit takes about 2 hours. The view from the top is worth it.

activities.title: Matcha Breakfast at Nakamura Tokichi
activities.description: Famous matcha house with the richest matcha parfait and warabi mochi you'll ever taste.

activities.title: Kiyomizu-dera Temple
activities.description: Famous wooden temple built into the hillside with a stunning veranda overlooking the city.

activities.title: Walk through Ninenzaka & Sannenzaka
activities.description: Charming stone-paved lanes lined with traditional wooden buildings, tea houses, and craft shops.

activities.title: Nishiki Market Lunch
activities.description: "Kyoto's Kitchen" — a 400-year-old narrow market with 100+ stalls. Try dashimaki tamago, pickles, and yuba.

activities.title: Return to Tokyo
activities.description: Shinkansen back to Tokyo. Rest up — it's been an amazing weekend.
